author: mmusich
body:
backport of https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/38700

#### PR description:

The primary goal of this PR is to address the second point of issue https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/38669:

> Unrelated to the crash, but pixel people beware: using magField->nominalValue() as a physical value as in https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/38653/files#diff-cd4b91b1150cb8ea3ac6cdb24d49a6bd99f77a8320a5d4a60eeab3000ff42eb1R141 is not a good idea. `nominalValue()` is intended to be used as a label, and is truncated to int, with the corresponding loss of accuracy.
The method `inverseBzAtOriginInGeV()` was added to the interface for the benefit of pixel code (https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/35081), for example.

This is done by taking the value of the magnetic field from `inverseBzAtOriginInGeV()` (after having converted it from [GeV<sup>-1</sup>]  to [T]) instead of `nominalValue()`.
I profit of this PR to rename all the other member variable to follow the code rule pattern (rule 2.9: https://cms-sw.github.io/cms_coding_rules.html)

#### PR validation:

Tested successfully the multi-run harvesting mode recipe at https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/38641#issuecomment-1178053372;

title: [12.4.X] `SiPixelLorentzAnglePCLHarvester`: fetch precise B-field value from map via `inverseBzAtOriginInGeV`
